content:
BindingMemberInfo Struct

In this Article

Contains information that enables a Binding to resolve a data binding to either the property of an object or the property of the current object in a list of objects.

Syntax

Declaration

public struct BindingMemberInfo

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.ValueType
  • BindingMemberInfo

Remarks

The BindingMemberInfo is returned by the BindingMemberInfo property of the Binding class.

The BindingMemberInfo is created from the string passed to the BindingMemberInfo constructor.

Constructors summary

BindingMemberInfo(String)

Initializes a new instance of the BindingMemberInfo class.

Properties summary

BindingField

Gets the property name of the data-bound object.
BindingMember

Gets the information that is used to specify the property name of the data-bound object.
BindingPath

Gets the property name, or the period-delimited hierarchy of property names, that comes before the property name of the data-bound object.

Methods summary

Equals(Object)

Determines whether the specified object is equal to this BindingMemberInfo.
GetHashCode()

Returns the hash code for this BindingMemberInfo.

Operators summary

op_Equality(BindingMemberInfo,BindingMemberInfo)

Determines whether two BindingMemberInfo objects are equal.
op_Inequality(BindingMemberInfo,BindingMemberInfo)

Determines whether two BindingMemberInfo objects are not equal.

Constructors

  • BindingMemberInfo(String)

    Initializes a new instance of the BindingMemberInfo class.

    public BindingMemberInfo (string dataMember);

    Parameters

    • dataMember
      String

      A navigation path that resolves to either the property of an object or the property of the current object in a list of objects.

    Remarks

    A BindingMemberInfo is created automatically when you call the BindingMemberInfo constructor with a control-property name, data source, and navigation path. The dataMember parameter contains the BindingMember string.

Properties

  • BindingField

    Gets the property name of the data-bound object.

    public string BindingField { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The property name of the data-bound object. This can be an empty string ("").

    Remarks

    The BindingField is the last item found in the navigation path returned by the BindingMember property. For example, if a new Binding is created that has a dataMember parameter of "Customers.custToOrders.OrderDate", BindingMember will return "OrderDate".

    Example

    The following code example gets the BindingMemberInfo of each Binding on a form, and prints the BindingPath, BindingField, and BindingMember property values of BindingMemberInfo. 

    private:
   void PrintBindingMemberInfo()
   {
      Console::WriteLine( "
     BindingMemberInfo" );
      for each ( Control^ thisControl in this->Controls )
      {
         for each ( Binding^ thisBinding in thisControl->DataBindings )
         {
            BindingMemberInfo bInfo = thisBinding->BindingMemberInfo;
            Console::WriteLine( "     BindingPath: {0}", bInfo.BindingPath );
            Console::WriteLine( "     BindingField: {0}", bInfo.BindingField );
            Console::WriteLine( "     BindingMember: {0}", bInfo.BindingMember );
            Console::WriteLine();
         }
      }
   }

    private void PrintBindingMemberInfo()
{
   Console.WriteLine("
     BindingMemberInfo");
   foreach(Control thisControl in this.Controls)
   {
      foreach(Binding thisBinding in thisControl.DataBindings)
      {
         BindingMemberInfo bInfo = thisBinding.BindingMemberInfo;
         Console.WriteLine("     BindingPath: " + bInfo.BindingPath);
         Console.WriteLine("     BindingField: " + bInfo.BindingField);
         Console.WriteLine("     BindingMember: " + 
         bInfo.BindingMember);
         Console.WriteLine();
      }   
   }
}

    Private Sub PrintBindingMemberInfo()
   Console.WriteLine(ControlChars.Cr + " BindingMemberInfo")
   Dim thisControl As Control
   Dim thisBinding As Binding
   For Each thisControl In  Me.Controls    
      For Each thisBinding In  thisControl.DataBindings
         Dim bInfo As BindingMemberInfo =  _
         thisBinding.BindingMemberInfo
         Console.WriteLine(ControlChars.Tab + _
         " BindingPath: "  + bInfo.BindingPath)
         Console.WriteLine(ControlChars.Tab + _
         " BindingField: " + bInfo.BindingField)
         Console.WriteLine(ControlChars.Tab + _
         " BindingMember: "  + bInfo.BindingMember)
         Console.WriteLine()
      Next thisBinding
   Next thisControl
End Sub
  • BindingMember

    Gets the information that is used to specify the property name of the data-bound object.

    public string BindingMember { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      An empty string (""), a single property name, or a hierarchy of period-delimited property names that resolves to the property name of the final data-bound object.

    Remarks

    A BindingMemberInfo is created automatically when you call the BindingMemberInfo constructor with a control-property name, data source, and navigation path. The dataMember parameter contains the BindingMember string.

    The BindingMember is the period delimitated combination of the BindingPath and BindingField values. For example, when a new Binding is created by using a dataMember parameter of "Customers.custToOrders.OrderDate", BindingMember will return "Customers.custToOrders.OrderDate".

    Example

    The following code example gets the BindingMemberInfo object of each Binding on a form, and prints the BindingPath, BindingField, and BindingMember property values of BindingMemberInfo. 

    private:
   void PrintBindingMemberInfo()
   {
      Console::WriteLine( "
     BindingMemberInfo" );
      for each ( Control^ thisControl in this->Controls )
      {
         for each ( Binding^ thisBinding in thisControl->DataBindings )
         {
            BindingMemberInfo bInfo = thisBinding->BindingMemberInfo;
            Console::WriteLine( "     BindingPath: {0}", bInfo.BindingPath );
            Console::WriteLine( "     BindingField: {0}", bInfo.BindingField );
            Console::WriteLine( "     BindingMember: {0}", bInfo.BindingMember );
            Console::WriteLine();
         }
      }
   }

    private void PrintBindingMemberInfo()
{
   Console.WriteLine("
     BindingMemberInfo");
   foreach(Control thisControl in this.Controls)
   {
      foreach(Binding thisBinding in thisControl.DataBindings)
      {
         BindingMemberInfo bInfo = thisBinding.BindingMemberInfo;
         Console.WriteLine("     BindingPath: " + bInfo.BindingPath);
         Console.WriteLine("     BindingField: " + bInfo.BindingField);
         Console.WriteLine("     BindingMember: " + 
         bInfo.BindingMember);
         Console.WriteLine();
      }   
   }
}

    Private Sub PrintBindingMemberInfo()
   Console.WriteLine(ControlChars.Cr + " BindingMemberInfo")
   Dim thisControl As Control
   Dim thisBinding As Binding
   For Each thisControl In  Me.Controls    
      For Each thisBinding In  thisControl.DataBindings
         Dim bInfo As BindingMemberInfo =  _
         thisBinding.BindingMemberInfo
         Console.WriteLine(ControlChars.Tab + _
         " BindingPath: "  + bInfo.BindingPath)
         Console.WriteLine(ControlChars.Tab + _
         " BindingField: " + bInfo.BindingField)
         Console.WriteLine(ControlChars.Tab + _
         " BindingMember: "  + bInfo.BindingMember)
         Console.WriteLine()
      Next thisBinding
   Next thisControl
End Sub
  • BindingPath

    Gets the property name, or the period-delimited hierarchy of property names, that comes before the property name of the data-bound object.

    public string BindingPath { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The property name, or the period-delimited hierarchy of property names, that comes before the data-bound object property name.

    Remarks

    The BindingPath is the period delimitated combination of property names that comes before the BindingField in the navigational path returned by the BindingMember property. For example, when a new Binding is created that has a dataMember parameter of "Customers.custToOrders.OrderDate", BindingPath will return "Customers.custToOrders".

    Example

    The following code example gets the BindingMemberInfo of each Binding on a form, and prints the BindingPath, BindingField, and BindingMember property values of BindingMemberInfo. 

    private:
   void PrintBindingMemberInfo()
   {
      Console::WriteLine( "
     BindingMemberInfo" );
      for each ( Control^ thisControl in this->Controls )
      {
         for each ( Binding^ thisBinding in thisControl->DataBindings )
         {
            BindingMemberInfo bInfo = thisBinding->BindingMemberInfo;
            Console::WriteLine( "     BindingPath: {0}", bInfo.BindingPath );
            Console::WriteLine( "     BindingField: {0}", bInfo.BindingField );
            Console::WriteLine( "     BindingMember: {0}", bInfo.BindingMember );
            Console::WriteLine();
         }
      }
   }

    private void PrintBindingMemberInfo()
{
   Console.WriteLine("
     BindingMemberInfo");
   foreach(Control thisControl in this.Controls)
   {
      foreach(Binding thisBinding in thisControl.DataBindings)
      {
         BindingMemberInfo bInfo = thisBinding.BindingMemberInfo;
         Console.WriteLine("     BindingPath: " + bInfo.BindingPath);
         Console.WriteLine("     BindingField: " + bInfo.BindingField);
         Console.WriteLine("     BindingMember: " + 
         bInfo.BindingMember);
         Console.WriteLine();
      }   
   }
}

    Private Sub PrintBindingMemberInfo()
   Console.WriteLine(ControlChars.Cr + " BindingMemberInfo")
   Dim thisControl As Control
   Dim thisBinding As Binding
   For Each thisControl In  Me.Controls    
      For Each thisBinding In  thisControl.DataBindings
         Dim bInfo As BindingMemberInfo =  _
         thisBinding.BindingMemberInfo
         Console.WriteLine(ControlChars.Tab + _
         " BindingPath: "  + bInfo.BindingPath)
         Console.WriteLine(ControlChars.Tab + _
         " BindingField: " + bInfo.BindingField)
         Console.WriteLine(ControlChars.Tab + _
         " BindingMember: "  + bInfo.BindingMember)
         Console.WriteLine()
      Next thisBinding
   Next thisControl
End Sub

Methods

  • Equals(Object)

    Determines whether the specified object is equal to this BindingMemberInfo.

    public override bool Equals (object otherObject);

    Parameters

    • otherObject
      Object

      The object to compare for equality.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if otherObject is a BindingMemberInfo and both stem.Windows.Forms.BindingMemberInfo.BindingMember* strings are equal; otherwise false.

    Remarks

    The BindingMember strings are compared with a culture setting of InvariantCulture.

  • GetHashCode()

    Returns the hash code for this BindingMemberInfo.

    public override int GetHashCode ();

    Returns

    • Int32

      The hash code for this BindingMemberInfo.

Operators

  • op_Equality(BindingMemberInfo,BindingMemberInfo)

    Determines whether two BindingMemberInfo objects are equal.

    public static bool op_Equality (System.Windows.Forms.BindingMemberInfo a, System.Windows.Forms.BindingMemberInfo b);

    Parameters

    • a
      BindingMemberInfo

      The first BindingMemberInfo to compare for equality.

    • b
      BindingMemberInfo

      The second BindingMemberInfo to compare for equality.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the stem.Windows.Forms.BindingMemberInfo.BindingMember* strings for a and b are equal; otherwise false.

  • op_Inequality(BindingMemberInfo,BindingMemberInfo)

    Determines whether two BindingMemberInfo objects are not equal.

    public static bool op_Inequality (System.Windows.Forms.BindingMemberInfo a, System.Windows.Forms.BindingMemberInfo b);

    Parameters

    • a
      BindingMemberInfo

      The first BindingMemberInfo to compare for inequality.

    • b
      BindingMemberInfo

      The second BindingMemberInfo to compare for inequality.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the stem.Windows.Forms.BindingMemberInfo.BindingMember* strings for a and b are not equal; otherwise false.
